article.title: Photometric redshifts for the next generation of deep radio continuum surveys - I: Template fitting

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 illustrates the multi-wavelength classifications of sources in the full spectroscopic redshift samples. What does this figure reveal about the overlap between radio detected sources, X-ray sources, IR AGN, and optical/spectroscopic/infrared selected AGN?
choices: There is complete overlap between all four populations.
There is significant overlap between the radio detected sources and all three AGN populations.
The X-ray, IR AGN, and radio source populations are largely distinct populations with only partial overlap.
Only the X-ray and IR AGN populations show significant overlap.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2 shows the multi-wavelength classifications of radio detected sources within the spectroscopic redshift sample. Which field exhibits a higher proportion of radio-detected sources classified as IR AGN?
choices: Both fields show roughly equal proportions.
This information cannot be determined from the figure.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 presents the flux and luminosity distributions of radio-detected sources within the spectroscopic samples. What can be inferred about the radio luminosity of X-ray detected sources and IR AGN compared to the median of the sample?
choices: X-ray detected sources and IR AGN typically have a lower radio luminosity than the sample median.
X-ray detected sources and IR AGN typically have a higher radio luminosity than the sample median.
The radio luminosity of X-ray detected sources and IR AGN is consistent with the sample median.
This information cannot be determined from the figure.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4 displays the optical magnitude vs. redshift distributions of radio-detected sources. Which field probes to significantly fainter magnitudes?
choices: Both fields probe to similar magnitudes.
This information cannot be determined from the figure.
